SEARCH
Package com.landawn.abacus.util

Class Try<T extends AutoCloseable>

java.lang.Object
com.landawn.abacus.util.Try<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the resource that extends AutoCloseable.
public final class Try<T extends AutoCloseable> extends Object
This class provides a mechanism to handle operations that may throw exceptions in a controlled manner. It is designed to work with resources that implement the AutoCloseable interface, ensuring that resources are properly closed after use. The class provides static and instance methods to run or call operations that may throw exceptions. If an exception occurs during the operation, it is handled in a manner specified by the user.

  • Method Details

    • with

      public static <T extends AutoCloseable> Try<T> with(T targetResource) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new Try instance with the specified target resource. This method is useful for creating a Try instance that manages the specified AutoCloseable resource. The resource will be automatically closed after the operation.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the resource that extends AutoCloseable
      Parameters:
      targetResource - the resource to be managed by the Try instance
      Returns:
      a new Try instance managing the specified target resource
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the targetResource is null

    • with

      public static <T extends AutoCloseable> Try<T> with(T targetResource, Runnable finalAction) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new Try instance with the specified target resource and final action. This method is useful for creating a Try instance that manages the specified AutoCloseable resource. The resource will be automatically closed after the operation, and the specified final action will be executed.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the resource that extends AutoCloseable
      Parameters:
      targetResource - the resource to be managed by the Try instance
      finalAction - the action to be executed after the resource is closed
      Returns:
      a new Try instance managing the specified target resource and final action
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the targetResource or finalAction is null

    • with

      public static <T extends AutoCloseable> Try<T> with(Throwables.Supplier<T,? extends Exception> targetResourceSupplier) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new Try instance with the specified target resource supplier. This method is useful for creating a Try instance that manages the specified AutoCloseable resource. The resource will be automatically closed after the operation.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the resource that extends AutoCloseable
      Parameters:
      targetResourceSupplier - the supplier to provide the resource to be managed by the Try instance, must not be null
      Returns:
      a new Try instance managing the specified target resource supplier
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the targetResourceSupplier is null

    • with

      public static <T extends AutoCloseable> Try<T> with(Throwables.Supplier<T,? extends Exception> targetResourceSupplier, Runnable finalAction) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new Try instance with the specified target resource supplier and final action. This method is useful for creating a Try instance that manages the specified AutoCloseable resource. The resource will be automatically closed after the operation, and the specified final action will be executed.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the resource that extends AutoCloseable
      Parameters:
      targetResourceSupplier - the supplier to provide the resource to be managed by the Try instance, must not be null
      finalAction - the action to be executed after the resource is closed, must not be null
      Returns:
      a new Try instance managing the specified target resource supplier and final action
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the targetResourceSupplier or finalAction is null

    • run

      public static void run(Throwables.Runnable<? extends Exception> cmd)
      Executes the provided cmd that may throw an exception. This method is useful when you want to run a piece of code that might throw an exception. If an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd, it is rethrown as a RuntimeException.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The runnable task that might throw an exception. Must not be null.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd.
      See Also:
      • Throwables.run(Throwables.Runnable)

    • run

      public static void run(Throwables.Runnable<? extends Exception> cmd, Consumer<? super Exception> actionOnError)
      Executes the provided cmd and if an exception occurs, applies the actionOnError consumer on the exception.

      This method is useful when you want to run a piece of code that might throw an exception and you want to handle that exception in a specific way.

      Parameters:
      cmd - The runnable task that might throw an exception, must not be null.
      actionOnError - The consumer to handle any exceptions thrown by the cmd, must not be null.
      See Also:
      • Throwables.run(Throwables.Runnable, Consumer)

    • call

      public static <R> R call(Callable<R> cmd)
      Executes the provided cmd that may throw an exception and returns the result. This method is useful when you want to run a piece of code that might throw an exception and you need the result of that code. If an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd, it is rethrown as a RuntimeException.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The callable task that might throw an exception and returns a result. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      The result of the cmd.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd.
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        Throwables#call(java.util.concurrent.Callable)

    • call

      public static <R> R call(Callable<R> cmd, Function<? super Exception,? extends R> actionOnError)
      Executes the provided cmd that may throw an exception and returns the result. If an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd, the actionOnError function is applied to the exception to provide a return value. This method is useful when you want to run a piece of code that might throw an exception and you need the result of that code. It allows you to handle exceptions in a specific way by providing a function that can transform an exception into a return value.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The callable task that might throw an exception and returns a result. Must not be null.
      actionOnError - The function to apply to the exception if one is thrown by the cmd. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      The result of the cmd or the result of applying the actionOnError function to the exception if one is thrown.
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        Throwables#call(java.util.concurrent.Callable, Function)

    • call

      public static <R> R call(Callable<R> cmd, Supplier<R> supplier)
      Executes the provided cmd that may throw an exception and returns the result. If an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd, the supplier is used to provide a return value. This method is useful when you want to run a piece of code that might throw an exception and you need the result of that code. It allows you to handle exceptions in a specific way by providing a supplier that can provide a return value when an exception occurs.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The callable task that might throw an exception and returns a result. Must not be null.
      supplier - The supplier to provide a return value when an exception occurs. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      The result of the cmd or the result of the supplier if an exception occurs.
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        Throwables#call(java.util.concurrent.Callable, Supplier)

    • call

      public static <R> R call(Callable<R> cmd, R defaultValue)
      Executes the provided cmd that may throw an exception and returns the result. If an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd, the provided default value is returned. This method is useful when you want to run a piece of code that might throw an exception and you need the result of that code. It allows you to handle exceptions in a specific way by providing a default value that will be returned when an exception occurs.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The callable task that might throw an exception and returns a result. Must not be null.
      defaultValue - The default value to return if an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd.
      Returns:
      The result of the cmd or the default value if an exception occurs.
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        Throwables#call(java.util.concurrent.Callable, Object)

    • call

      public static <R> R call(Callable<R> cmd, Predicate<? super Exception> predicate, Supplier<R> supplier)
      Executes the provided cmd and if an exception occurs, applies the supplier to provide a return value. The predicate is used to test the exception. If the predicate returns true, the supplier is used to provide a return value. If the predicate returns false, the exception is rethrown as a RuntimeException.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The callable task that might throw an exception, must not be null.
      predicate - The predicate to test the exception, must not be null.
      supplier - The supplier to provide a return value when an exception occurs and the predicate returns true, must not be null.
      Returns:
      The result of the cmd or the result of the supplier if an exception occurs and the predicate returns true.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an exception occurs and the predicate returns false.
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        Throwables#call(java.util.concurrent.Callable, Predicate, Supplier)

    • call

      public static <R> R call(Callable<R> cmd, Predicate<? super Exception> predicate, R defaultValue)
      Executes the provided cmd that may throw an exception and returns the result. If an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd, the provided default value is returned if the predicate returns true. If the predicate returns false, the exception is rethrown as a RuntimeException. This method is useful when you want to run a piece of code that might throw an exception and you need the result of that code. It allows you to handle exceptions in a specific way by providing a default value that will be returned when an exception occurs and the predicate returns true.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The callable task that might throw an exception and returns a result. Must not be null.
      predicate - The predicate to test the exception. If it returns true, the default value is returned. If it returns false, the exception is rethrown. Must not be null.
      defaultValue - The default value to return if an exception occurs during the execution of the cmd and the predicate returns true.
      Returns:
      The result of the cmd or the default value if an exception occurs and the predicate returns true.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an exception occurs and the predicate returns false.
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        Throwables#call(java.util.concurrent.Callable, Predicate, Object)
